intro: Tinus leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leafed tinus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow as it matures. Tinus leptantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
